comment: She's super sweet and wants you to succeed. She does a lot of hands on theatre things, for example we had to write and preform our own play as our final. You write essays on plays you have to go watch but as long as you answer all the criteria, you'll make an a.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment:
Her class improved my self-esteem bc she complimented my terrible art :). Super kind and caring. Loves teaching. 

Grades on 4 essays about plays, the big group performance, and a few easy assignments. Grades the essays tough but fair, read her feedback and improve each essay using it. USE MLA!

Took her in 2017. Super nice & always took her time to explain things and made life easy for all of us. There's a big group project where you do have to act in front of everyone (the class), but don't worry, she is very understanding. She doesn't expect you to be pro. And there is a textbook you need, as you will get quizzed on it.

This was by far my funniest class ever. Almost everyday you get on stage and do something fun and interactive in a group. And unlike other theatre classes you don't read hamlet or perform it you get to write your own play in a group and perform it. If you wanna have a fun class this is the one to take. This class is basically 100% participation.

Professor Adkins was wonderful. She comes to class so enthusiastic every morning. Not a hard class at all, if you don't participate and come to class you won't pass. The group projects were super fun. If you are shy this class will definitely help you come out of your shell! Loving teacher who truly cares about her students! 10/10 recommend her.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: go to class, participate in group work, EASY A

Shes so nice but you have to work in her class. you might get tired of it here are there. if you do the work and show her that you are putting effort, youll get an A if not then idk for you. if you want an easy A, this class aint it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: One of my favorite teachers. Professor Adkins is so sweet and nice. I'm not a theater major nor do I like performing in front of people, but I ended up really liking the class. Attendance is mandatory though because you have to create a play with group she assigns you.
She actually made me enjoy and want to go to a fine arts class which I thought was impossible. And shes a dime��

For two years I was dreading taking my fine arts requirement. However, I actually enjoyed Adkins class. She is the sweetest more caring professor I've had in a long time. She gives you a 100 on everything as long as you do it and put in a little effort. Have to go see 3 plays throughout the semester but just get through that and you have an easy A.

Easy A, just more work than I expected. Have to read the textbook and take online quizzes almost weekly but they're easy and answers can be found online. She's super nice and understanding. She doesn't force you to act or expect you to be good at it. I had a fun time even though I hate acting and have no interest in theatre.

The class is kind of annoying and embarrasing you have to put on a play which you have to sing in fornt of the whole class. The class is an easy A. You just participate youll get a A. Shes very sweet and joyful but you should be a theatre person if you take this class.
